results.title: Pat Garrett and Billy the Kid
results.creator_credit: Sam Peckinpah, Gordon Carroll and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: Sam Peckinpah is one of the Western genre’s greatest directors. “Pat Garrett and Billy the Kid” is both a celebration of the mythic West and a eulogy to its passing. James Coburn plays Garrett, still intent on settling his revenge with the outlaw Billy the Kid (Kris Kristofferson). Billy is now tired of being an outlaw, always on the run. The confrontation between these two men forms the core of this film, a battle between old violent codes and a resigned acceptance of vulnerability. Bob Dylan wrote the musical score and he also appears as the mysterious Alias, a member of the Kid’s gang. This haunting film continues Peckinpah’s exploration of the masculine worlds of violence and competition, but the gentle performances of Kristofferson and Dylan look towards a new world based on different values. A classic western.

results.title: Pat Cash tennis my way
results.brief_description: Pat Cash and his coach Ian Barclay look at aspects of the game of tennis. Features special slow motion and still sequences to help study Pat’s technique. Also covers highlights from Grand Slam, Wimbledon and Davis Cup matches.

results.title: Pat and Mike
results.creator_credit: George Cukor, Lawrence Weingarten and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: Spencer Tracy and Katharine Hepburn are sparring partners in this punchy comedy, of two good sports who stage a never ending romantic battle. Katharine Hepburn plays “Pat”, an all-round woman athlete who is a whiz at golf, tennis, baseball, basketball, boxing, archery and Judo. Spencer Tracy superbly enacts the part of “Mike”, an unschooled, rough-mannered Broadway promoter who already has a racing horse, and a heavy-weight fighter (Aldo Ray) as “clients” and who, possessing the top horse is now determined to have the “top woman”.

results.title: Pat and Eddy's greyhound racing family
results.creator_credit: Brian McKenzie, Daniel Scharf, AFFC, ABC-TV (Australia) and Film Victoria
results.brief_description: Brian McKenzie documents the Seager family who are a family dedicated to the racing of their beloved greyhounds. The family has grown-up with the ritual of training, caring and racing the dogs, but as the teenagers grow up, their independent lives take them increasingly away from this family pursuit. Tenderly compiled with sometimes humorous but gentle observations of the family, we are led more deeply into the psyche of the Australian spirit.

results.title: Pasteur's experiments
results.creator_credit: Yasuaki Okada, Masaji Hara and Gakken Company
results.brief_description: A puppet film which shows the history of experiments dealing with the spontaneous generation of life. Demonstrates that microbes do not arise spontaneously from meat. Good for showing the experimental method.

results.title: Pasteur
results.brief_description:
A biopic of the famous doctor whose research culminatd with the discovery of a vaccine against rabbies.

Credits: Director, writer, Sacha Guitry ; photography, Jean Bachelet ; music, Louis Beydts.
Cast: Sacha Guitry, Jean Perier, Henry Bonvallet, Gaston Dubosc, Francois Rodon.
